solidbase.core
Interface CommandListener

All Known Implementing Classes:
AssertExistsOrEmptySelect, ImportCSV, OracleDBMSOutputPoller, PrintSelect
public interface CommandListener

A CommandListener listens to commands from the upgrade or SQL file as they are being processed.

Since:
Apr 1, 2006 7:13:28 PM
Author:
René M. de Bloois

Method Summary
 boolean execute(CommandProcessor processor, Command command)
          Called when a command from the upgrade file needs to be executed.
 void terminate()
          Gives this listener a chance to cleanup.
 

Method Detail

execute

boolean execute(CommandProcessor processor,
                Command command)
                throws SQLException
Called when a command from the upgrade file needs to be executed. Commands can be transient or persistent (see Command.isTransient). This method should return true if it accepted the command. Problems caused by the user (command syntax, configuration mistakes or problems in data files) should be wrapped in a FatalException. SQLExceptions should be wrapped in a SQLExecutionException. You can choose to give it the original command that triggered this listener or the actual SQL being sent to the database. You may choose to let the SQLException pass, then SolidBase will wrap it for you.

Parameters:
processor - The command processor.
command - The command that needs to be executed.
Returns:
True if it accepted the command.
Throws:
SQLException - Whenever an unhandled SQLException is thrown.

terminate

void terminate()
Gives this listener a chance to cleanup. For example to kill threads that it started or temporary tables that it created.
